citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC), National Marine Mammal Laboratory (NMML)
citeinfo.title: A Marine Mammal Ecosystem Model for the Bering Sea

abstract.p: This is a report on a model of the Bering Sea ecosystem describing trophodynamic relationships in the eastern Bering Sea. A detailed analysis of all eastern Bering Sea and eastern North Pacific pelagic data collected by the United States during research carried out on northern fur seals since 1958 on distribution, reproductive rates and feeding is in progress and initial results have been used in this report. Information on other marine mammals, fisheries stocks, and oceanographic data have been combined with an analysis of fur seal data as part of a study of the dynamics of the Bering Sea ecosystem. The amount of food consumed by fur seals and other marine mammals has been compared with the amount of fish caught in commercial fisheries in the same waters. All of these data have been included in this model.

[Reference: McAlister, W.B. and M.A. Perez. A marine mammal ecosystem model for the Bering Sea. National Marine Fisheries Service. 1977. 36 p.] This is an unpublished report available at the NOAA NMML Library.

descript.purpose: To examine some of the relationships between marine mammals and fisheries in order to improve our understanding of how fisheries and mammals interact in the Bering Sea.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
